== Working with Bugs ==

* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MeetingLogs/devweek1001/DetailingBugs|Getting More Detailed Bug Reports]]</nowiki> - Class given at Ubuntu Developer Week in January of 2010 by BrianMurray
* <nowiki>[[BugSquad-KnowledgeBase-Classes-Triaging | Triaging Class]]</nowiki> - Class given at Ubuntu Open Week in May of 2008 by PedroVillavicencio
* <nowiki>[[MeetingLogs-openweekhardy-ReportBugs2|Reporting Bugs Class]]</nowiki> - Class given at Ubuntu Open Week in May of 2008 by BrianMurray
* <nowiki>[[MeetingLogs-openweekMaverick-BugTriagingDo'sAndDoNot's|Triaging DOs and DO NOTs Class]]</nowiki> - Class given at Ubuntu Open Week in October 2010 by <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Hggdh|C de-Avillez]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-HowToTriage|How to Triage]]</nowiki> - General summary of how to properly triage bug reports
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-BestPractices|Best Practices]]</nowiki> - Useful Do's and Don't's for bug reporting
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Improving|Improving a Report]]</nowiki> - How to improve a bug report - an essential part of triaging
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Checklist|Checklist ]]</nowiki> - A checklist of common actions to perform for bug reports
* <nowiki>[[ Bugs-HowToTriage-Charts | Bug Status Charts ]]</nowiki> - Find out what the Bug Workflow looks like
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-FindRightPackage|Find the Right Package]]</nowiki> - How to assign a bug to the correct package
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Status|Managing Status]]</nowiki> - When Ubuntu uses which bug status and what they mean to us
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Importance|Managing Importance]]</nowiki> - The criteria for setting a bug's importance and definitions
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Description|Improving the Bug Description]]</nowiki> - Ways to communicate useful information in the bug description
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Tags|Bug Tags]]</nowiki> - In Launchpad it is possible to add "tags" or keywords to a bug report - this is Ubuntu's standardized list
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Patches|Patch attachments]]</nowiki> - What is considered a patch and what should happend to bugs with patches.
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Assignment|Assigning Bugs]]</nowiki> - When to assign bug reports to individuals or teams
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-MarkingDuplicate|Marking a Duplicate]]</nowiki> - How and when to mark a bug as a duplicate of another
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Watches|Bug Watches]]</nowiki> - How to set up Launchpad to monitor bug reports in other bug tracking systems.
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-ConvertToQuestion|Converting to a Question]]</nowiki> - How to convert a bug report to a support question.
* <nowiki>[[DebuggingProcedures|Debugging Procedures]]</nowiki> - Common procedures for debugging types of problems or packages
* <nowiki>[[DeveloperResponsibilities|Developer Responsibilities]]</nowiki> - Are you trying to find a developer familiar with a particular package or subsystem?  Find out how here!
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-ApportRetraces|Apport Retraces]]</nowiki> - How to understand and use Apport retraces (based on a MOTU/School class by EmmetHikory)
* <nowiki>[[Bugs-EasyTasks|EasyTasks]]</nowiki> - A list of Easy/Medium/Hard Triaging Tasks.

== Bug Squad Videos and Presentations ==

* <nowiki>[[http://people.canonical.com/~brian/presentations/2010-02-bug-triage.odp|How to Triage Presentation]]</nowiki> - A presentation by Brian Murray about Bug Triage
* <nowiki>[[http://youtu.be/Vl-cQDAlPFc | How to Confirm a bug task ]]</nowiki> - Video showing three different ways to confirm a bug task

== Bug Tools ==

* <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses|Standard Replies]]</nowiki> - A collection of frequently used replies to bug reports setup for easy copy and pasting
* <nowiki>[[https://help.launchpad.net/Bugs/EmailInterface|Modifying bugs via e-mail]]</nowiki> - Launchpad Bugs has an e-mail interface for working with bugs
* <nowiki>[[ Bugs-HowToFilter | Filtering bug mail ]]</nowiki> - Example procmail rules for filtering any bug e-mail you get
* <nowiki>[[ https:--help.launchpad.net-API-launchpadlib | launchpadlib ]]</nowiki> - launchpadlib, packaged as '''python-launchpadlib''' in Ubuntu, is a python library for reading and writing to Launchpad - including bugs
* <nowiki>[[ http:--launchpad.net-ubuntu-+source-firefox-launchpad-plugin | Firefox Extension that adds Launchpad integration ]]</nowiki> - Provides quick searches for a variety of Launchpad items - packaged as  '''firefox-launchpad-plugin''' in Ubuntu
* <nowiki>[[ https:--launchpad.net-~gm-dev-launchpad-+archive-ppa | Firefox Extension that modifies Launchpad pages ]]</nowiki> - A PPA package of a Firefox Extension collecting Greasemonkey scripts that Launchpad users find useful
* BugHelper - bughelper is a tool to help us triage bugs by parsing reports for clues about the type of bug and then allowing us to share those clues with other triagers
* <nowiki>[[ https:--code.launchpad.net-~ubuntu-bugcontrol-apport-ubuntu-bugpatterns | Apport Bug Patterns ]]</nowiki> - bug patterns are checked by apport when filing crash reports and are useful for preventing unnecessary duplicate reports in Launchpad
* <nowiki>[[ http:--packages.ubuntu.com-maverick-devscripts | Ubuntu Developer Scripts ]]</nowiki> - The '''devscripts''' package includes a lot of useful tools including rmadison which tells you the current package version for every supported release of Ubuntu.
* <nowiki>[[ https:--launchpad.net-ubuntu-qa-tools | Ubuntu QA Tools ]]</nowiki> - The '''ubuntu-qa-tools''' package is a collection of useful tools that Ubuntu QA team uses to make their daily work a lot easier.
* <nowiki>[[ https:--launchpad.net-bughugger | Bug Hugger ]]</nowiki> - Bug Hugger is an extensible Python/pgtk Client for Managing Bug Tasks related to Ubuntu on Launchpad
* <nowiki>[[ https:--launchpad.net-arsenal | Arsenal ]]</nowiki> - a toolset for interacting with Launchpad, generating specialized reports, performing powerful operations against launchpad, and assisting in the generation and testing of software packages. Primarily used by the Xorg team.
* <nowiki>[[BugSquad-Factoids| Factoids]]</nowiki> - A collection of frequently used bot factoids

== Launchpad Bug Queries ==

* <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-datecreated&field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.importance%3Alist=UNDECIDED&assignee_option=none&field.assignee=&field.bug_reporter=&field.bug_contact=&field.bug_commenter=&field.subscriber=&field.component-empty-marker=1&field.status_upstream-empty-marker=1&field.omit_dupes.used=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch.used=&field.has_cve.used=&field.tag=&field.tags_combinator=ANY&field.has_no_package.used=&field.has_no_package=on&search=Search|New and No Package]]</nowiki> - These bugs need triaging and a package
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-datecreated&search=Search&field.status%3Alist=New&field.importance%3Alist=Undecided&field.assignee=&field.bug_reporter=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch=&field.component%3Alist=1&field.component%3Alist=2&field.has_no_package=|New Bugs]]</nowiki> - These bugs have not been triaged at all
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/bugtrackers/|Bugtrackers in Launchpad]]</nowiki> - Useful for finding lists of links between bugs reported in Launchpad and upstream bug reports
* <nowiki>[[One Hundred Papercuts]]</nowiki> - Trivial to fix, but annoying bugs. Ideal for getting started helping with bugs.
